sen.j: 大紋（だいもん）は、日本の着物の一種で男性用。
sen.e: Daimon is a sort of Japanese kimono for males.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代頃から直垂に大きな文様を入れることが流行った。
sen.e: Around the Kamakura Period, it became fashionable to put large patterns on Hitatare (a kind of court dress in old days)

sen.j: 室町時代に入ってからは直垂と区別して大紋と呼ぶようになった。
sen.e: In the Muromachi Period, that sort of kimono was called Daimon to be distinguished from Hitatare.

sen.e: There was a big difference between Daimon and Hitatare or Suo: family crests were dyed out at ten parts of Daimon, including larger family crests at the back, right and left front sides, back side of each sleeve, and the backside of the hakama and smaller crests at two places of the front part of the hakama.
